message: virtualenvwrapper.project has support for custom project templates. There are templates for django and bitbucket projects. What other templates I make?
How about one to check out the Python source code for sprinting?
I'm working on a static site generator, and plan on making a virtualenvwrapper.project template for it
it'll be similar to your Django one, so that one gets the credit for giving me the idea :)
Have you seen blogofile? It looks like it has some promise.
Have not. I've seen many site generators, but none really appealed to me so far.
Plus, I like the project. I think it'll be a fun learning experience.
Yeah, it can be fun to work on something like that from scratch.
Maybe I missed it but I recall looking for documentation on project templates and not finding much tasty ones.
@dag There aren't a lot of them, yet. That's why I'm looking for ideas for examples I could write.

@dag I don't know enough about PasteScript to say. The "template" is a Python or shell script, so you can do anything you want with it. See virtualenvwrapper.django and virtualenvwrapper.bitbucket for examples so far.
@doughellmann blogofile is slick. I've been loveing it since I found it. Plus it let me make more fabric stuff it, so I like it's flexability there.
@morganiangoose One of these days I'll find the time to convert my site. I need to figure out how to tie in the existing Sphinx stuff I have cobbled together.
@doughellmann into the site as blog posts or as a seperate section unto itself?

@morganiangoose That's part of what I need to decide. I have some custom extensions to Sphinx to generate parts of the site I have now, so I either need to rewrite them or just incorporate the Sphinx content as-is.
